content.description: Sit start on decent jugs below the sharp edge of the roof. Throw right for a sloper that is the lip of the roof. Heel hook, and work your feet to navigate towards two crimps on the face above said roof (crux). Once this roof is surmounted, undercling and get ready to pull another easier roof to an easy yet blancey stance below the lip of the ridge that will place you on a decent foot ledge. Exit out left on a casual topout.
content.location: This climbs the low roof that is the main part of the Crap Traverse Wall.

content.description: Use this to log any of the myriad V-easy / V0 problems that exist on the Crap Traverse Wall. I often warm up here, enjoy tinkering on a lot of these lines, and would like a way to capture them in my ticks but don't think this warrants creating individual problems for each one.
content.protection: A pad is helpful, and spotters are nice. There are mostly very good landings.
content.location: These are on the Crap Traverse Wall from the small gully on the north end to where the wall peters out on the south end.

content.description: This is a traverse with decent length that climbs from the left side of the wall to the right. Climb through several different faces and corners with good rests.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter to shuffle the pad.
content.location: This traverses entire length of Crap Traverse Wall.
